p.seg: In the 8th year of the reign of king Wu,
he led a punitive expedition against Qi,
triumphing greatly over them,
he came back
and then had a celebratory banquet set up in the great hall of Duke Wen.
Duke Gao (of) Bi served as (main) guest,
the Duke protector (of) Shao, Shi, served as help (to the main guest),
the Duke uncle of Zhou, Dan, served as host,
Duke Quan Jia of Xin served as an (intermediary) position (between guest and host)
The official in charge of documents, Yi, was the guest in the Eastern Hall,
Lu Shang Fu Ming was appointed as superintendant over the correctness (of drinking procedures= a go-between between guest and host),
inspecting the alcoholic drinks.
The king put down the cup and thanked the Duke of Bi
and composed a song (?) called:
'happily enjoying good wine'
"happily enjoying good wine,
having a banquet to honor the two dukes.
trustworthy and joyous are the brothers,
harmonious and concordant the multitude
Magnificent and martial，
majestically ruling the country
drink fast the fine goblet,
and then another goblet will follow."
The king put down the cup and thanked the Duke of Zhou
and composed a song (?) called:
'the light chariot'
"The light chariot is already set up (?),
the men are ready and I am not distressed
I make the soldiers rise (ready) to fight with their swords,
they are the cream of the people
Magnificent and martial，
they can subdue the enemies
drink fast the fine goblet,
and then another goblet will follow
The Duke of Zhou put down the cup and thanked the Duke of Bi
and composed a song (?) called:
'grand, grand'
"Grand, grand the military attire,
magnificent, martial, strong and valiant
earnest and masterly in devising plans,
therefore obtaining rich virtue
the king has good wine,
our cares are dispelled
we are already drunk and yet still urged to drink,
tomorrow we will not have to go over (into battle) (?)
The Duke of Zhou again put down the cup and thanked the king
and composed a celebratory song (?) called:
'clear and bright lord on high'
clear and bright lord on high,
sending down this light (?)
great and distinguished he came,
enjoying the sacrificial offers
the moon has an established track
the planet Jupiter has a standard path.
I compose this celebratory song,
(to be enjoyed) for one thousand years without end.
The Duke of Zhou grabbed the cup without drinking,
the crickets jumped up and down the hall,
the Duke of Zhou composed a celebratory song (?) called:
'the crickets'
"the crickets are in the hall,
the military carts are going.
Now that gentleman
is very joyful and happy
That day [...],
[...] disorder.
one should not be excessive in joy,
then at the end one can be at rest.
Resting in joy without disorder,
this is the way of the good gentleman
The crickets are on the mat,
the year will then be drawing to a close
Now that gentleman
is very joyful and happy
days and months stride forth,
from dawn to dusk.
one should not be excessive in happiness,
then at the end one can have blessings.
Resting in joy without disorder,
this is the constant preoccupation of the good gentleman
The crickets are on the wall,
the year will then [...]
[...] until summer,
one should not be excessive in happiness,
then at the end one can be wary (and so avoid failures)
happy and joyful without disorder,
this is the constant preoccupation of the good gentleman
